That's great Sandy. The only thing I ask is no selective roars. you
can't have a roar that only affects Maximals just like I cant have
Scourge set a bomb that when it goes off only affects his enemies.

Other than that have at it ;-)

-Preston

On 8/10/11, Sandy Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:
> Sure, let's do that instead.  Sonic roar can be more fun
>
> Perpetually on the move and constantly busy.
>
> On Aug 10, 2011, at 2:25 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
>> Sandy,
>>
>> I just had a question. One that has nagged me for a day or so now but
>> I keep forgetting to ask it. Why did you change Tuscon's motiff or
>> signature?
>>
>> When he was Tuscon in the begining he had sonar attacks, and even when
>> he was converted to his Prime form he kept that style. But when you
>> converted him to Drgon you gave him fire, which is a departure from
>> what he was.
>>
>> Also keep in mind that Rodimus already has a fire motiff, and now you
>> will kind of have two of them running around. :)
>>
>> Why not give Tuscon a sonic breath attack rather than fire? Keep in
>> mind, not all dragons had a fire attack. Sonics would go along better
>> with what he was. It would still be a very powerful attack. Look at
>> the Combaticon Brawl, who actually has a similar personality to Tuscon
>> I think - but he has an ear splitting 300-decibel bursts of
>> concentrated sound as well as a 10-Megawatt electron gun, which would
>> be a lightning breath attack as well?? (although you can't use them
>> both together)
>>
>> And you also have Thundercracker as an example who had a sonic boom
>> attack that can be heard for 200 miles. Sonic attacks are very
>> effective weapons and then it would make sense that someone could hear
>> Tuscon's roar hundreds of miles away.
>>
>> It would be different from fire, but I think it would be a lot more in
>> keeping with who Tuscon was as he was more of a sound based figure
>> rather than a fire based one. He wouldn't neccessarilly have the sonar
>> and all the other special stuff, but one could see how he shifted over
>> and where he came from.
>>
>> Does this make sense?
>>
>> - Preston
>>
>
